moves.1. e4: White starts off with the king pawn opening...
moves.1... e6: ...And I reply with the French Defence.
moves.4. Nf3: ...Which he defends with the knight. Standard is 4. c3
moves.5. c3: ...Caleb defends with the c2 pawn going to c3.
moves.5... Qb6 6. Be3: This is bad. I saw Qxb2 a few moves later.
moves.6... f6: But, I try to develop my other knight to f6 by trading.
moves.7. Bd3 c4 8. Bc2: The bishop stays on th b1-h7 diagonal...
moves.8... Qxb2: ...But here I realize how bad 6. Be3 is.
moves.12... Nf6: I stop a potential threat Qh5+, but h6 was the way to go, being that if 13. Qh6+ g6 and the queen is attcked by the g-pawn. The bishop cannot take due to Nxg6.
moves.14. Ngf3 Nxf3+ 15. Nxf3 Bd6 16. Re1 O-O: I am not sure why Caleb wants the queens off the board. I am winning by 3 pawns.
My opponents gladly falls into my trap...
moves.25. Rd6: Which my opponent declines, falling into a deadly mating net.
